ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course did not have any teaching, just facilitating senior research.
How to think up, design, and conduct a research study, as well as how to deal with all the bumps in the road that accompany research
loads, read lots of literature, learned to code in R, delivered three presentations.
I learned a lot about lab techniques and how science works in the lab
I learned how to work as part of a research team.
Understanding of the scientific method, working on a research project with a team
I gained comfort with independent research and data analysis, as well as some familiarity with collaboration with an advisor in an academic setting.
How to research scientific inquiries

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It is very dependent on your PI, which can be a strength and/or a weakness.

Overall, a large weakness in the course was a lack of communication.  The experience of research itself was great but guidelines for what the thesis should look like and when it was due were not well-communicated.  It would be helpful to have these guidelines at the beginning of the semester without having to ask for them and without them changing.

Strength: can do any topic youd like
Weaknesses: cant think of any

fun! Just remember to choose a lab/ project that you are interested. 
Requires you to be resourceful and learn a lot on your own. But this is the best part, figuring out things, trouble shooting, instead of sitting in the lecture passively.

I think I could have been more on top of finding a lab in a timely manner. I got lucky in that I was able to find a lab that I loved working in at the last minute, but I really feel as though I could have been informed of the urgency needed to actually find a lab in a timely manner. I am not sure if it was just me that found themself in a stressful position of finding a lab, but I do wish that I started looking earlier and asking earlier and was aware of the urgency required to find a lab on time.

It's hard to provide any commentary on the strengths and weaknesses of this course because it seems to me like the range of experiences is very wide, and a lot depends on collaboration with an advisor.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: E&EB professors were very understanding of the fact that students were living through a pandemic and this were willing to adapt to students altered research plans
not really. all good
I wish I could have been in the lab.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would absolutely recommend this class. Even though its required, it came me an opportunity to do some great research.

yep. senior thesis is fun! 
choose a project that you like and a mentor who has time for you, and just work a lot. 
be resourceful, learn to code and draw graphs with matlab or r.
It's a senior thesis so you have to, but I had a good time and learned a lot even though it took up a lot of time.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: There were no class meetings, my lab research for my thesis was done remotely.
synchronous research on a topic of the students choice
Self guided research
This was my research which was in person in the lab.
senior thesis research
It was a senior thesis so I worked in-person in a lab and then wrote the paper myself at home.
Individual research for a lab (virtual/remote)
This was a thesis course, guided by independent research and collaboration with an advisor.
It was in association with a lab but all research was done independently.
